snippet: The government’s antipiracy case against Richard O’Dwyer is unusual because he did not publish pirated content himself but pointed the way for others.
abstract: Richard O’Dwyer, an enterprising 24-year-old college student from northern England, finds himself in the middle of a fierce battle between Hollywood and the Internet, two of America’s great exports; at issue is a Web site he started that helped visitors find American movies and television shows online; Obama administration is seeking to extradite Mr. O’Dwyer from Britain on criminal charges of copyright infringement.
lead_paragraph: The government’s antipiracy case against Richard O’Dwyer is unusual because he did not publish pirated content himself but pointed the way for others.

headline.seo: U.S. Pursues Richard O’Dwyer as Intermediary in Online Piracy
headline.main: U.S. Pursuing a Middleman in Web Piracy
headline.print_headline: U.S. Pursuing A Middleman In Web Piracy
